nwayo

/nwajo/ (haitian creole) The tough central part of various fruits, containing the seeds.


⚭ What is nwayo ?

  • A completely hackable front end boilerplate
  • A multi-theme, multi-site, multi-CMS front end framework
  • A back end agnostic environment

⚭ Requirements (All latest) - Installation guide

  • Node.js (nwayo)
  • Ruby (Sass)
  • GraphicsMagick / ImageMagick

⚭ Get started

  • Get the files under boilerplate
  • Replace PROJECT_NAME in bower.json and package.json with your project's name

Run in nwayo root folder

nwayo install workflow
nwayo install vendors
nwayo rebuild

⚭ Tools  

nwayo is HTML5-ready and uses gulp as a build system

  • Based (but not mandatory) on Zurb Foundation
  • Uses Bower as dependencies manager and EditorConfig for consistency

⚭ Styling

  • CSS3-ready via Autoprefixer and linted via stylelint
  • Comes with Sass
  • Minifies with cssnano

⚭ Scripting

  • ES2018-ready via Babel and linted via ESLint
  • Comes with jQuery, Modernizr, Lodash, pinki, JsRender, kafe
  • Builds with gulp-include and is minified with UglifyJS

⚭ Other

  • Optimizes images via gifsicle, jpegtran, optipng, svgo
  • Generates iconography via GraphicsMagick, ImageMagick
  • Optimized for Atom with AtomLinter

⚭ Tried and tested

Currently deployed on 200+ sites including:

  • Drupal
  • Wordpress
  • Symfony
  • Magento 1 & 2 (On Premise & Cloud)
  • Sitecore
  • Insite (On Premise & Cloud)
  • Shopify

⚭ Components

Multiple component boilerplates available

See the releases.
